stroke.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if someone has a stroke, an artery (=tube carrying blood) in their brain suddenly bursts or becomes blocked, so that they may die or be unable to use some muscles
stroke.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She died following a massive stroke.
I looked after my father after he had a stroke.
stroke.translation[0].definitions[1].def: one of a set of movements in swimming or rowing in which you move your arms or the oar forward and then back
stroke.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: She swam with strong steady strokes.
stroke.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a style of swimming or rowing
stroke.translation[0].definitions[3].def: the action of hitting the ball in games such as tennis, golf, and cricket
stroke.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a single movement of a pen or brush when you are writing or painting
stroke.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: A few strokes of her pen brought out his features clearly.
stroke.translation[0].definitions[5].def: a line made by a pen or brush
stroke.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: the thick downward strokes of the characters
stroke.translation[0].definitions[6].def: an action of hitting someone with something such as a whip or thin stick
stroke.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: He cried out at each stroke of the whip.
stroke.translation[0].definitions[7].def: a gentle movement of your hand over something
stroke.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: I gave her hair a gentle stroke.
stroke.translation[0].definitions[8].def: a single sound made by a clock giving the hours, or by a bell, gong etc
stroke.translation[0].definitions[9].def: used when you are saying a number written with the mark (/) in it
stroke.translation[0].definitions[9].exa: The serial number is seventeen stroke one (=17/1).
stroke.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: Two years later she had a stroke which left her paralysed.
Her brother has just died of a massive stroke.
She had a minor stroke five years ago.
He suffered a fatal stroke in April.
stroke.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to move your hand gently over something
stroke.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: He reached out and stroked her cheek tenderly.
stroke.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to move something somewhere with gentle movements of your hand
stroke.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: He lifted her face and stroked her hair from her eyes.
stroke.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to hit or kick a ball with a smooth movement in games such as tennis, golf, and cricket
stroke.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: He stroked the ball into an empty net, with a minute to go.
